newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Henderson China in low-cost housing - paper.
newsitem.headline: Henderson China in low-cost housing - paper.

text.p: Henderson China Holdings Ltd has signed a letter of intent to invest US$360 million in developing subsidised housing units in the northern Chinese city of Tianjin, Sing Tao Daily said on Thursday.

Henderson China, a spinoff of Henderson Land Development Co Ltd, will build 20,000 flats comprising two million square metres of housing, the newspaper quoted an official of the Tianjin Low-Cost Housing Working Group, Wei Jianhua, as saying in Tianjin.
Henderson China was not immediately available for comment.
"If Henderson completes the project within two years they will get a total return of about 17.5 percent," Wei said.

The municipal government would buy the houses from Henderson at a price 15 percent above the construction cost and would also pay 10 percent annual interest on the financing provided by Henderson, it added.
This would be the first time Henderson China has participated in a Chinese government subsidised housing project.
Henderson China mainly engages in office and retail developments and the building of luxury residential units in Shanghai, Guangzhou and Beijing.
